description.text: In order to get water more consistently you will need to use the Centrifugal Separator you will get a little bit of water while supplying it with power and saplings. Please be careful and dont use up all of your saplings!

longDescription.text: You MUST use the QDS to hand in this task. Click select task, place the QDS, and right click it with the quest book. Placing the QDS next to the Centrifugal Separator with the output set to the appropriate side will work.

description.text: You may have noticed the lack of food on this planet. Well, I have a temporary solution. You might not like it but given the only alternative is starving...

longDescription.text: Salt can be obtained by sifting dust
Kill a few zombies to get some rotten flesh
Combining 2 salt and 1 rotten flesh in any order in a crafting grid will make  1 zombie jerky

description.text: Choose this path if you want a challenge. Expect to die alot. Note: Choosing this path will disable the easy route quest.
After setting up a furnace you can begin setting up for lava smelting!

Now that you are stable and able to survive somewhat comfortably, Its time to start planning on your future.
You can melt some scraps found on the cities to make some plastic sheets.
Thankfully you wont be cooking from a furnace forever. Youll need to craft a few kitchen utensils for better food recipes.

longDescription.text: Make sure to vary your diet as eating to much of one item will make it give you less nutrition.

description.text: For an easier experience, this is the way. Note: Choosing this path disables the hard route quest.
Is it just me or does this planet have a lot of undead hostiles. The lack of any life forms baffle me as to how endless they feel.

longDescription.text: Because of some hqm limitations, you will have to get the mob drops!

description.text: Till the end of the night
If you havent noticed water is hard to find on this dry planet. If you get desperate enough you can mix your canteen with a dirt block to get some dirty water.
Dirty water may help you in a pinch however long term survival will require you to purify it. Smelting your dirty water bottle in a furnace will provide you with a purified water bottle.
Placing leaves into a crucible will melt them down into water!
Trading in ten bottles of purified water should allow me to create you something strong.

The shell constructor has been updated. 

In order for you to properly use it you must first create a clone with the shell constructor and then use the shell storage to store your original body. 

Make sure your INVENTORY IS EMPTY otherwise you wont have your items.

longDescription.text: Please make sure you use the shell constructor and storage properly otherwise you may lose your world!

description.text: Well zombie jerky on its own proably isn't enough. If you are in direenough straits almost anything looks edible

longDescription.text: Don't forget you can craft a frying pan out of bones. Don't ask me how that works. The silk worms come from hitting leaves with a crook. You can cook the wroms in a furnace, smoker, or frying pan.

description.text: Well, that is a mess. Grab what you can from the wreck, and watch out for that detached engine. The core has been breached and the fuel is leaking.

longDescription.text: Tasks of this type do not have to be handed in, having them in one's inventory is enough. However, you MUST have all the items at once. The water skin is used to

description.text: As hot as it is here, it isn't nearly hot enough to cook food. For that, you will need a furnace. Sieve dirt for stones, use the stones to make cobblestone, from that comes a slab furnace

longDescription.text: With eight slabs you can craft a slab furnace! All the functionality of a full furnace with lower costs.

description.text: Thankfully this dust is chock full of metal shards. You shouldve noticed youve gathered chunks of metal when sifting. Combine them into an ore and smelt them in a furnace
Ok, so zombie jerky and silk worms are horrible for long term food, however youre alive! Well sort of... heres another recipe

longDescription.text: Place 1 bone and a pot in any crafting grid to make 3 stock, While the stock it self is edible you can also use it to make other stews.
With your stock you can combine it with a pot and spider eye for some spider eye soup.

description.text: Sifting dust will help you get bonemeal. With 1 dust and a bottle of water I can provide you with some basic starting items.
You may need to move fluids, energy, and items. Lets set up some pipe work.
To survive out here, you will need some basic tools, a weapon, and some protection from attack.

longDescription.text: Careful! Armor will effect your temperature. Metal armor tends to be hotter during the day and colder at night. Leather and wood armor will add a little heat no matter the time. The best armors can help you stay cool in the heat and warm in the cold.

description.text:
Seems like this planet it's full of oil!
With the Gas Lift and some pressure, you can pump up Oil from the dust deeps.
You can use the oil to generate energy with the Compression Dynamo, but later you will need a Refinery to make plastic and most efficient fuels.
Now that youve finally gotten a foot hold on this dusty planet, we still are in need of a food supply.

longDescription.text: The watering can will allow you to speed up crop growth without the use of bonemeal. However it will consume water.

description.text: Before you're able to get a smeltery up and running you will need to get invar.

longDescription.text: In order to start making beginner alloys youll need to "create" a mill
